sentence: Technology stocks were firming in recent trading, with the shares of tech stocks in the S&P 500 were adding more than 1.1% in value while the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index was rising just under 1.0%.

(-) Coherent ( COHR ) dropped to a two-year low on Monday, sinking almost 8% to its lowest share price since October 2016 at $122.15 apiece, after the lasers and laser-based technology Monday lowered its Q4 revenue outlook below analyst estimates.

The company is now expecting between $460 million to $461 million in revenue for the three months ended Sept. 30, down from its prior call looking for quarterly revenue in a range of $465 million to $485 million and missing the Street view expecting $471.9 million.
Coherent will report it Q4 financial results on Nov. 6.

(+) Advanced Micro Devices ( AMD ) climbed over 8% at one point on Monday after the chipmaker announced a $2.5 million partnership with Acceleware (AXE.V), calling on the Canadian software firm to provide engineering resources and consulting services over the next four months.

Acceleware is expecting to immediately use proceeds from the new contract to advance commercial-scale testing of its RF XL technology using radio waves to heat and liquefy tarry bitumen deposits so they can be pumped to the surface.
(+) Five9, Inc. ( FIVN ) was more than 4% higher this afternoon after the cloud contact center software company said Ryan Kam has joined the company as chief marketing officer.
He comes to Five9 from AppDynamics, where he re-branded the company and directed its IPO roadshow.
He previously held a range of roles at Salesforce ( CRM ), including creative director for the flagship Dreamforce conference and head of digital marketing for the company.

(+) Yandex N.V ( YNDX ) still was hanging on to a thin gain Monday afternoon, giving back almost all of an over 11% advance that followed the Russian language search engine company saying its current strategic review may or may not lead to any proposal to change its capital structure or to any potential transaction.

The company also acknowledged recent media speculation about potential changes to its capital structure but said it won't be making additional public comments does not intend to comment further or disclose any developments unless required.
